articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: A cast member unfurls a Palestinian flag during a curtain call, prompting a brief scuffle as an official tried to take it away.
articles.title: Performer launches Gaza flag protest on Royal Opera House stage

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Rachel Booth, 38, was last seen on Saturday morning at a petrol station in Northwich, police say.
articles.title: Wild Shore Delamere closes in search for missing Rachel Booth

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Dillon Falls, near the city of Bend, has a 15-foot (4.5-metre) drop that turns into "churning rapids".
articles.title: One person killed and two missing after going over Oregon waterfall

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The Reform leader tells the BBC his councillors are being "hamstrung" by existing bureaucracies.
articles.title: Reform UK councillors obstructed by officials, Nigel Farage says

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The world's race to decarbonise has led to the rise of electric cars - and with it, soaring demand for lithium, which is required for the batteries
articles.title: The rise of green tech is feeding another environmental crisis

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Anna Rutherford finished so far ahead in the Bamburgh to Edinburgh race that she was home by the time her rivals crossed the finish line.
articles.title: Scottish runner finishes ultra-marathon two hours ahead of competitors

articles.author: BBC Sport
articles.description: England defender Jess Carter says she will take a step back from social media after experiencing "a lot of racial abuse" during Euro 2025, with police called in to investigate further.
articles.title: Jess Carter: England defender to step away from social media after 'a lot of racial abuse' at Euros

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The coach involved in the crash has now been recovered and police continue to investigate.
articles.title: Four remain in hospital after Somerset school coach crash

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Drivers at Edinburgh Airport say they resent paying high fees for dropping off passengers.
articles.title: Airport drivers try to beat drop-off charges by parking in laybys

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) said it had "fired warning shots" and disputed the number of reported deaths.
articles.title: Israeli forces kill 67 Palestinians seeking aid in northern Gaza, Hamas-run ministry says
